Posts.Title: What happens at gynaecologist appt?

Posts.Content: Hi I have finally decided to have my ovaries removed after many years of thinking about it/burying my head in the sand. I am very fortunate in that I have not had cancer so far, but I am BRCA2.  There is no ovarian cancer in my family, only breast cancer but my rationale is the following: - it is what the doctors say I should do as my best chance for minimising my risks. - ovarian cancer is not easily detected and  having them removed seems sensible since I have finished having children. - any problems with surgical menopause cannot be worse than ovarian cancer. - my risk of breast cancer is also reduced by having my ovaries removed. I hope that helps and makes sense! Best wishes as you decide xx
